com.esri.mo2.data.odb
Class CachedObjectDataStore

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.data.odb.ObjectDataStore
        |
        +--com.esri.mo2.data.odb.CachedObjectDataStore
All Implemented Interfaces:
CacheListener
public class CachedObjectDataStore
extends ObjectDataStore
implements CacheListener

This object data is based on a disk based persistent heap and a memory based object cache. Given any object that can be serialized and an associated object identifier, this class creates an object database without multi-user considerations and without a frontend cache.

Constructor Summary

          Constructs a Cached Object Data Storage system which utilizes a front-end cache, a memory based hash table, and a disk based heap.

                             String readWriteMode,
                             int cacheSize)

Constructs a Cached Object Data Storage system which utilizes a front-end cache, a memory based hash table, and a disk based heap.

Parameters:
file - the file specifier
bCreate - a boolean variable - True, if file should be created, else False
readWriteMode - the read/write mode of the disk based heap
cacheSize - the cache size in number of objects (not bytes)

getHitRatio

public double getHitRatio()
Returns the hit ratio for the disk cache. The returned value will be between 0 and 1 (inclusive). A value of 0.0 indicates the physical disk was hit on every access, while a value of 1.0 indicates that every object requested was in the LRU memory based object cache. A value of -1.0 is returned if no data is available.

Returns:
the ratio of memory cache hits to total accesses.

resetStatistics

public void resetStatistics()
Resets the hit ratio statistics for the disk cache.

overflow

public void overflow(Comparable objectId,
                     Object object,
                     boolean bOnDisk)
Description copied from interface: CacheListener
Invoked when the maximum size of the cache is exceeded. This method removes the given objects from the cache.

Specified by:
overflow in interface CacheListener
Parameters:
objectId - the object id
object - the object to be removed
bOnDisk - flag if the object is on disk
